...and walk around the grounds, and see (in crude paper-model-esque VR form) exactly what I used to see when visiting... lord.
They're both long dead, the house sold years ago. I hadn't seen it in a long time. To be able to stand on the driveway in VR & look at it...

Just spent an hour or so flying around southern California in Google Earth VR. Relaxing.
Also visited my grandparents' house.

And every human who's ever lived, lived here, & nowhere else.
Spent 2 hours flying around the planet. Extraordinary, elevating experience.
Immediate physical non-abstract reminder that oh right, we just have this one planet, and here it is, and we're all alive on it.
Start in space, hovering over the planet. Stars all around. Spin the globe, zoom in anywhere, right down to street level. God-like.

Got a Vive. Hooked it up. Spent the evening playing around in VR.
Exploring Google Earth in VR is close to a religious experience.
